# BIRD-INTERACT 1.0

Content: ## ‚ö†Ô∏è Announcement Please note that before your evaluation process, when Docker loads the databases, errors may occasionally occur due to environment inconsistency (these will not terminate the process but will appear in the Docker logs). As a result, some databases may fail to load properly, leading to empty databases. This will cause the evaluation results to be abnormally low. üëâ Therefore, we strongly recommend checking the Docker logs for any errors **before running the evaluation** and verifying that all databases have been successfully loaded. ## üì∞ News - [2025-08-26] üöÄ We're excited to announce the release of the **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)** set! It's a tough one ‚Äî the best LLMs are only achieving a **16.33%** success rate, with just **10.0%** on the `c-interact` and `a-interact` portions. üëâ For more details, please visit our [project website](https://bird-interact.github.io/). - [2025-08-26] üì¨ We'll be sending the **Ground Truth & Test cases** to our mailing list this week. If you want early access, please send an email as instructed on the site for an **automatic download**. - [2025-08-26] üíæ On another note, we've also released a SQLite version of **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** for easier local research. The full **LiveSQLBench-Base** and **-Large** versions are coming soon! - [2025-08-22] **Bug Fix**: In Bird-Interact-Agent code, we fixed a bug that when evaluating phase-2 SQL, the stored phase-1 SQL cannot be executed successfully, leading to a lower success rate of Phase-2. This bug only affects those tasks where phase1 sql does some operations on the database, e.g. CREATE table, etc. ## üß∏ Overview BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**. The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations.
Translation: ## ‚ö†Ô∏è Aviso Por favor, note que antes do processo de avalia√ß√£o, quando o Docker carrega os bancos de dados, podem ocorrer erros ocasionalmente devido √† inconsist√™ncia do ambiente (estes n√£o encerram o processo, mas aparecer√£o nos logs do Docker). Como resultado, alguns bancos de dados podem n√£o ser carregados corretamente, levando a bancos de dados vazios. Isso far√° com que os resultados da avalia√ß√£o sejam anormalmente baixos. üëâ Portanto, recomendamos fortemente verificar os logs do Docker para quaisquer erros **antes de executar a avalia√ß√£o** e garantir que todos os bancos de dados tenham sido carregados com sucesso. ## üì∞ Novidades - [26-08-2025] üöÄ Estamos animados para anunciar o lan√ßamento do conjunto **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)**! Este √© dif√≠cil ‚Äî os melhores LLMs est√£o alcan√ßando apenas **16,33%** de taxa de sucesso, com apenas **10,0%** nas partes `c-interact` e `a-interact`. üëâ Para mais detalhes, visite nosso [site do projeto](https://bird-interact.github.io/). - [26-08-2025] üì¨ Enviaremos os **Ground Truth & Test cases** para nossa lista de e-mails esta semana. Se quiser acesso antecipado, envie um e-mail conforme instru√ß√µes no site para obter um **download autom√°tico**. - [26-08-2025] üíæ Em outra nota, tamb√©m lan√ßamos uma vers√£o SQLite do **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** para facilitar pesquisas locais. As vers√µes completas **LiveSQLBench-Base** e **-Large** estar√£o dispon√≠veis em breve! - [22-08-2025] **Corre√ß√£o de Bug**: No c√≥digo do Bird-Interact-Agent, corrigimos um bug que, ao avaliar SQL da fase-2, o SQL armazenado da fase-1 n√£o pode ser executado com sucesso, levando a uma taxa de sucesso menor na Fase-2. Este bug afeta apenas tarefas onde o sql da fase1 faz opera√ß√µes no banco de dados, como CREATE table, etc. ## üß∏ Vis√£o Geral O BIRD-INTERACT, um benchmark interativo de text-to-SQL, **reimagina a avalia√ß√£o Text-to-SQL sob a √≥tica de intera√ß√µes din√¢micas**. O ambiente mescla uma base de conhecimento hier√°rquica, documenta√ß√£o do banco de dados e um simulador de usu√°rio orientado a fun√ß√µes para recriar ambientes empresariais aut√™nticos com opera√ß√µes completas de **CRUD**.

RowTranslations.originContent: BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: O BIRD-INTERACT, um benchmark interativo de text-to-SQL, **reimagina a avalia√ß√£o Text-to-SQL sob a √≥tica de intera√ß√µes din√¢micas**.

RowTranslations.originContent: The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: O ambiente mescla uma base de conhecimento hier√°rquica, documenta√ß√£o do banco de dados e um simulador de usu√°rio orientado a fun√ß√µes para recriar ambientes empresariais aut√™nticos com opera√ß√µes completas de **CRUD**.

Content:
It offers two rigorous test modes: (1) passive **Conversational Interaction** and (2) active **Agentic Interaction**, spanning 600 annotated tasks including Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD operations and etc., each guarded by executable test cases. Typical evaluations trigger 1,968-5,496 interaction turns between model and user simulator, while state-of-the-art reasoning models currently solve only **‚âà24%** and **‚âà18%** of tasks, underscoring the benchmark's challenge.

### ‚úÖ Two Evaluation Modes BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`. ### üê£ Lite Version We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation. ### ü¶ú Full Version The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon. ### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **c-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | üèÜ Excellent Chat | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | üíé Good Chat | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | üíé Good Chat | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | ‚ö™ Basic | #### 2. **a-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Budget Parameters* | Avg Steps/Task | Avg Cost (USD)/Task | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:|
Translation:
Ele oferece dois modos de teste rigorosos: (1) **Intera√ß√£o Conversacional** passiva e (2) **Intera√ß√£o Agente** ativa, abrangendo 600 tarefas anotadas incluindo Intelig√™ncia de Neg√≥cios (BI), opera√ß√µes CRUD, entre outras, cada uma protegida por casos de teste execut√°veis. As avalia√ß√µes t√≠picas desencadeiam entre 1.968 e 5.496 turnos de intera√ß√£o entre modelo e simulador de usu√°rio, enquanto os modelos de racioc√≠nio de ponta atualmente resolvem apenas **‚âà24%** e **‚âà18%** das tarefas, destacando o desafio do benchmark.

### ‚úÖ Dois Modos de Avalia√ß√£o O BIRD-INTERACT suporta dois modos de avalia√ß√£o conforme mencionado acima: - **c-Interact**: Intera√ß√£o Conversacional, que √© um modo passivo e o fluxo de trabalho √© fixo. O c√≥digo e informa√ß√µes detalhadas podem ser encontrados em `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact**: Intera√ß√£o Agente, que √© um modo ativo incorporado onde o fluxo de trabalho √© din√¢mico e conduzido pelos modelos. O c√≥digo e informa√ß√µes detalhadas podem ser encontrados em `bird_interact_agent`. ### üê£ Vers√£o Lite Estamos lan√ßando uma vers√£o lite do BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, que inclui 270 tarefas reais de alta qualidade especificamente para PostgreSQL. Este √© um bom ponto de partida para experimenta√ß√£o r√°pida. ### ü¶ú Vers√£o Completa A vers√£o completa do BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, √© um benchmark abrangente que inclui 600 tarefas para PostgreSQL. Cobre uma ampla gama de opera√ß√µes SQL e consultas de usu√°rio. A vers√£o completa estar√° dispon√≠vel em breve. ### Resultados de Desempenho de Modelos no BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **c-Interact** Desempenho | Classifica√ß√£o | Nome do Modelo | Recompensa Normalizada | N√≠vel | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | üèÜ Chat Excelente | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | üíé Bom Chat | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | üíé Bom Chat | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | ‚ú® Padr√£o | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | ‚ú® Padr√£o | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | ‚ö™ B√°sico | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | ‚ö™ B√°sico | #### 2. **a-Interact** Desempenho | Classifica√ß√£o | Nome do Modelo | Par√¢metros de Or√ßamento* | M√©dia de Passos/Tarefa | M√©dia de Custo (USD)/Tarefa | Recompensa Normalizada | N√≠vel | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:|

Content:
| 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | üèÜ Excellent Interaction | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | üíé Good Interaction | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | üíé Good Interaction | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | ‚ú® Standard | | 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15.3 | $0.4594 | 18.37 | ‚ú® Standard | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13.2 | $0.0337 | 17.26 | ‚ö™ Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12.0 | $0.0931 | 17.07 | ‚ö™ Basic | > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details. ### Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.

## üì¶ Dataset Details ### Dataset Description - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details. - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts: - `selected_database`: The name of the database. - `query`: The unambiguous user query. - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities. - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query. - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges. - `sol_sql`: The ground truth SQL solution. - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction. - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database. - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL. - `follow_up`: The labeled follow up questions. - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task. - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory. - **Curated by:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud

| 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | üèÜ Excelente Intera√ß√£o | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | üíé Boa Intera√ß√£o | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | üíé Boa Intera√ß√£o | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | ‚ú® Padr√£o | | 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15.3 | $0.4594 | 18.37 | ‚ú® Padr√£o | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13.2 | $0.0337 | 17.26 | ‚ö™ B√°sico | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12.0 | $0.0931 | 17.07 | ‚ö™ B√°sico | > \* Par√¢metros de Or√ßamento: Or√ßamento Inicial/Or√ßamento de Paci√™ncia do Usu√°rio, medido por nossa moeda virtual *bird-coin*s . Consulte [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) para mais detalhes. ### Escalonamento de Tempo de Intera√ß√£o (ITS) Escalonamento de Tempo de Intera√ß√£o (ITS) refere-se √† capacidade de um modelo de aumentar continuamente seu desempenho final por meio de intera√ß√µes de m√∫ltiplos turnos. Quando esse desempenho interativo ultrapassa o desempenho idealizado de turno √∫nico em uma tarefa totalmente especificada e sem ambiguidades, dizemos que ele satisfaz a **lei ITS**. √Ä medida que a paci√™ncia do usu√°rio cresce e os turnos de intera√ß√£o se acumulam, o desempenho continua melhorando, demonstrando que o modelo pode manter uma comunica√ß√£o eficaz em di√°logos prolongados. Atualmente, apenas o claude-3-7-sonnet satisfaz a lei ITS.

## üì¶ Detalhes do Conjunto de Dados ### Descri√ß√£o do Conjunto de Dados - **Banco de dados:** O banco de dados PostgreSQL completo pode ser baixado do [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Confira a se√ß√£o [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) para mais detalhes. - **dados:** Cada inst√¢ncia de dados cont√©m as seguintes partes principais: - `selected_database`: O nome do banco de dados. - `query`: A consulta do usu√°rio sem ambiguidades. - `amb_user_query`: A consulta do usu√°rio com ambiguidades inseridas. - `user_query_ambiguity`: As ambiguidades inseridas na consulta do usu√°rio. - `non_critical_ambiguity`: Ambiguidades n√£o cr√≠ticas como ordem, limite, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity`: Ambiguidades criadas pelo mascaramento de conhecimentos externos. - `sol_sql`: A solu√ß√£o SQL de refer√™ncia. - `preprocess_sql`: Consultas SQL para executar antes da solu√ß√£o ou previs√£o. - `clean_up_sql`: Consultas SQL para executar ap√≥s os casos de teste para reverter altera√ß√µes feitas no banco de dados. - `test_cases`: Um conjunto de casos de teste para validar o SQL corrigido previsto. - `follow_up`: As perguntas de acompanhamento rotuladas. - `external_knowledge`: O conhecimento externo relacionado √† tarefa espec√≠fica. - **avalia√ß√£o:** O c√≥digo de avalia√ß√£o est√° dispon√≠vel no diret√≥rio [`./evaluation`](./evaluation). - **Curadoria:** Equipe BIRD & Google Cloud

Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: > \* Par√¢metros de Or√ßamento: Or√ßamento Inicial/Or√ßamento de Paci√™ncia do Usu√°rio, medido por nossa moeda virtual *bird-coin*s . Consulte [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) para mais detalhes.

RowTranslations.originContent: Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Escalonamento de Tempo de Intera√ß√£o (ITS) refere-se √† capacidade de um modelo de aumentar continuamente seu desempenho final por meio de intera√ß√µes de m√∫ltiplos turnos. Quando esse desempenho interativo ultrapassa o desempenho idealizado de turno √∫nico em uma tarefa totalmente especificada e sem ambiguidades, dizemos que ele satisfaz a **lei ITS**. √Ä medida que a paci√™ncia do usu√°rio cresce e os turnos de intera√ß√£o se acumulam, o desempenho continua melhorando, demonstrando que o modelo pode manter uma comunica√ß√£o eficaz em di√°logos prolongados. Atualmente, apenas o claude-3-7-sonnet satisfaz a lei ITS.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: style="width: 100%; min-width: 100px; display: block; margin: auto; ">

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **Banco de dados:** O banco de dados PostgreSQL completo pode ser baixado do [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Confira a se√ß√£o [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) para mais detalhes.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **dados:** Cada inst√¢ncia de dados cont√©m as seguintes partes principais:
- `selected_database`: O nome do banco de dados.
- `query`: A consulta do usu√°rio sem ambiguidades.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `amb_user_query`: A consulta do usu√°rio com ambiguidades inseridas.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `user_query_ambiguity`: As ambiguidades inseridas na consulta do usu√°rio.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `non_critical_ambiguity`: Ambiguidades n√£o cr√≠ticas como ordem, limite, etc.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `knowledge_ambiguity`: Ambiguidades criadas pelo mascaramento de conhecimentos externos.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `preprocess_sql`: Consultas SQL para executar antes da solu√ß√£o ou previs√£o.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `clean_up_sql`: Consultas SQL para executar ap√≥s os casos de teste para reverter altera√ß√µes feitas no banco de dados.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `test_cases`: Um conjunto de casos de teste para validar o SQL corrigido previsto.

RowTranslations.originContent: - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `external_knowledge`: O conhecimento externo relacionado √† tarefa espec√≠fica.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **avalia√ß√£o:** O c√≥digo de avalia√ß√£o est√° dispon√≠vel no diret√≥rio [`./evaluation`](./evaluation).

Content:
- **License:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/)
- **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite)

### Dataset Uses

To avoid data leakage by auto-crawling, we do not include GT solution sqls and test cases along with data.
please email [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) with the tag `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` in title for full set, which will be sent automatically.


<!-- ### Use the Dataset from HuggingFace

You can download the dataset from HuggingFace using the following command:

RowTranslations.originContent: You can download the dataset from HuggingFace using the following command:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Voc√™ pode baixar o conjunto de dados do HuggingFace usando o seguinte comando:

Content:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```
Translation:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```

Content: Or you can use the provided script to download the full version of the dataset and split it into different dialects.
Translation: Ou voc√™ pode usar o script fornecido para baixar a vers√£o completa do conjunto de dados e dividi-lo em diferentes dialetos.

Content:
```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path path/to/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path path/to/input.jsonl \ # Path to the input JSONL file (may be empty if you want to download the dataset from HuggingFace)
  --output_folder path/to/output_dir # output folder of the split files
``` -->
Translation:
```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path caminho/para/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path caminho/para/input.jsonl \ # Caminho para o arquivo JSONL de entrada (pode estar vazio se quiser baixar o conjunto de dados do HuggingFace)
  --output_folder caminho/para/output_dir # pasta de sa√≠da dos arquivos divididos
```
